ead.archdesc:
Collection Overview
Student Religious Organizations 1892-[ongoing]
Student Religious Organizations Records 1892-[ongoing]
RG 80 UUID:5f7bac5d-3714-481c-89e0-f12ca38b019c
18 boxes (9 linear ft.)
English
Smith College Archives
Northampton, MA
Contains minutes, correspondence, memos, photographs, printed material and general material related to student religious organizations at Smith College.
The Smith College Association for Christian Work (SCACW) was founded in 1892. It was designed, according to its constitution, "to promote the development of a broad and intelligent activity in the cause of humanity and to unite in one central body the organizations already existing in the college and those to be formed in future for the purpose of active Christian work." By 1953, the organization is identified as the Smith College Religious Association (SCRA), and is referred to as an 'interfaith' organization. Today this area of student life is referred to as Religious and Spiritual Life, and encompasses many different faiths and worshipping communities.
These records consist primarily of records of the Smith College Association for Christian Work and the Smith College Religious Association, the two largest identities of the religious organizations of Smith College's history. Types of materials include chapel correspondence, information on retreats and conferences, activities and services, committee minutes, press releases, announcements, reports, financial information, and photographs. The most recent records reflect the growing diversity of the college community and its varying faiths.
This collection is organized into four series:
SERIES I. RELIGIOUS ORGANIZATIONS, A-Z, 1980s-1990s
SERIES II. SMITH COLLEGE ASSOCIATION FOR CHRISTIAN WORK (SCACW), 1892-1977
SERIES III. SMITH COLLEGE RELIGIOUS ASSOCIATION (SCRA), 1941-1977
SERIES IV. RELIGIOUS SERVICES, 1886-2002
OVERSIZE MATERIALS
The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives except where noted in the finding aid.
Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.
Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Student Religious Organizations, Box #, Smith College Archives.
Periodic additions to collection are expected and may not be reflected in this finding aid.
The records of the Student Religious Organizations were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.
Processed by Anne Lozier, 2004
